shorts.title: Senior Care Expert Peter Tomasi of Scranton Explains How to Know When It’s Time for Home Care for HelloNation

shorts.title: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to Board of Directors
shorts.title_distilled: Fidelity Bank Welcomes James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A.
shorts.description: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.
shorts.content: DUNMORE, Pa., Jan. 02, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Brian J. Cali, Chairman of the Board of Fidelity Bank, is pleased to announce the appointment of James Clemente, CPA, MT and Rocco A. DelVecchio to its Board of Directors.

shorts.title: BREAKING: Pa. Health Department OKs Tenor Health acquisition application for 3 NEPA hospitals
shorts.description: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.
shorts.content_distilled: Pennsylvania Health Department officials have given their blessing to Tenor Health Foundation's application to acquire three Northeast Pennsylvania hospitals, multiple sources said Wednesday.

shorts.title: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa. Department of Health review
shorts.title_distilled: Tenor Health says NEPA hospital purchase deal remains under Pa.
shorts.description: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.
shorts.content: Tenor Health Foundation’s CEO said the company is ready to own and operate the Commonwealth Health Systems hospitals in NEPA, but that the transaction still awaits approval from the Pennsylvania Department of Health.

shorts.title: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud
shorts.title_distilled: Troopers claim retaliation in lawsuit over alleged payroll fraud.
shorts.description: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.
shorts.content: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov. Josh Shapiro and others, claiming they faced retaliation after reporting payroll fraud within the department.
shorts.content_distilled: Two Pennsylvania state troopers have filed a lawsuit against Gov.

shorts.title: Old Forge borehole’s mine water eyed for reclamation, hydroelectricity
shorts.title_distilled: Old Forge borehole’s mine water eyed for reclamation, hydroelectricity.
shorts.description: A mine-water reclamation plan has goals of diverting and purifying polluted borehole water, returning clean water to the river and, in the process, also generating hydroelectric power.
shorts.content: A mine-water reclamation plan has goals of diverting and purifying polluted borehole water, returning clean water to the river and, in the process, also generating hydroelectric power.
shorts.content_distilled: mine-water reclamation plan has goals of diverting and purifying polluted borehole water, returning clean water to the river and, in the process, also generating hydroelectric power.

shorts.title: AHL: Depth, development are pillars to Penguins’ success
shorts.title_distilled: AHL: Depth, development are pillars to Penguins’ success.
shorts.description: Entering the weekend, the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins didn’t have an active skater inside the top 90 among the American Hockey League’s scoring leaders. With Tristan Broz (28 points in 36 games, tied-61st in AHL in scoring) sidelined for the foreseeable future with an undisclosed injury, the team’s active leading score is Atley Calvert (24 points in 42 games, tied-95th in AHL in scoring) – a second-year pro who spent a large portion of last season in the ECHL with the Penguins’ affiliate Wheeling Nailers. The trades of several forwards off the Penguins’ roster over the course of the past eight weeks […]
shorts.content: Entering the weekend, the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins didn’t have an active skater inside the top 90 among the American Hockey League’s scoring leaders. With Tristan Broz (28 points in 36 games, tied-61st in AHL in scoring) sidelined for the foreseeable future with an undisclosed injury, the team’s active leading score is Atley Calvert (24 points in 42 games, tied-95th in AHL in scoring) – a second-year pro who spent a large portion of last season in the ECHL with the Penguins’ affiliate Wheeling Nailers. The trades of several forwards off the Penguins’ roster over the course of the past eight weeks […]
shorts.content_distilled: Entering the weekend, the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins didn’t have an active skater inside the top 90 among the American Hockey League’s scoring leaders.

shorts.title: Don’t let snow shoveling become a pain in the back
shorts.title_distilled: Don’t let snow shoveling become a pain in the back.
shorts.description: With seven weeks of winter left, NEPA has already had plenty of snow; it's important to keep in mind that shoveling snow can place excessive stress on the structures of the spine

shorts.title: Johnson College receives $75,000 to expand RISE program
shorts.title_distilled: Johnson College receives $75,000 to expand RISE program.
shorts.description: Johnson College received $75,000 in Lackawanna County job-creation funding from the Department of Planning and Economic Development to expand the transformative RISE (Readiness in Skilled Employment) program. From left: Karen Baker, senior director of grants and foundation relations, Johnson College; Katie Pittelli, Ed.D., president and CEO, Johnson College; Lackawanna County Commissioner Bill Gaughan; and Dr. Kellyn Williams, Ph.D., associate vice president of special programs, Johnson College.
shorts.content: Johnson College received $75,000 in Lackawanna County job-creation funding from the Department of Planning and Economic Development to expand the transformative RISE (Readiness in Skilled Employment) program. From left: Karen Baker, senior director of grants and foundation relations, Johnson College; Katie Pittelli, Ed.D., president and CEO, Johnson College; Lackawanna County Commissioner Bill Gaughan; and Dr. Kellyn Williams, Ph.D., associate vice president of special programs, Johnson College.
shorts.content_distilled: Johnson College received $75,000 in Lackawanna County job-creation funding from the Department of Planning and Economic Development to expand the transformative RISE  program.
